channel.title: Star Trek on The Outsider's Journey
channel.description: Recent content in Star Trek on The Outsider's Journey

item.title: LOG 1.23: End of Semester
item.description: 22nd July, 2011 Hello everyone, Yesterday I wrote the last exam of this Semester! Not sure when I will get results but IÂ´m sure what I did try, I got right.

item.title: LOG 1.14: A Trip to GÃ¶ttingen
item.description: 10th April, 2011 Hello everyone ðŸ™‚ I just returned from a trip to GÃ¶ttingen where my flatmates and I celebrated an old flatmate’s birthday. We took a train yesterday morning and I was quite taken in by the beauty of the countryside.

item.title: LOG 1.11: Light jackets and Programing
item.description: 13th March, 2011 Hi Everyone ðŸ™‚ We are halfway through March and temperatures are now ranging between 7-13! Quite warm (relatively) and it is now ok to venture out with either a light jacket with a heavy-ish sweater or with only one heavy jacket on.

item.title: A Brave New World of Equilibrium
item.description: The battle between emotion and control is an old one. It is fought by each of us in our lives as well as philosophers at a more conceptual level.

item.title: LOG 1.10: The first signs
item.description: 28th February, 2011 Hello, It is now possible to see the first signs of Spring. The trees are bearing buds that will leaf and flower forth.

item.title: LOG 1.9: Aerobics, Music, Star Trek
item.description: 17th February, 2011 Hello everyone, I just came back from an hour of the most exhausting exercise in probably Years! I never realised how out-of-shape I have been until I saw 60 odd other people able to jump around during what they call ‘Power Gym’ for an hour while I was out of breath within 15 minutes.

item.title: Android body vs Human body
item.description: A lot of futuristic science fiction puts forward several ideas of what an android would be like. Data from Star Trek (TNG) is an intriguing character who tries very hard to understand what it is to be human.

item.title: Star Trek : The Enemy Within
item.description: Dr McCoy mentions that he’d hate to agree with Spock. Captain Kirk starts to refer to himself as Kirk during communications. “He’s dead Jim” first time ðŸ™‚

item.title: Star Trek : The Naked Time
item.description: Captain Kirk still acknowledges calls as Captain instead of Kirk. Reily is a sub primary character.Sulu takes up fencing instead of Botany. End with ‘Steady as she goes’ instead of ‘Engage’ as in TNG.

item.title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
item.description: Crew has a different uniform. Spock smiles a little when he says ‘irritation’ is an Earth emotion and at the very end after he is told he has hope by Kirk when he admits he ‘felt for him too’.

item.title: Notes on Star Trek Original Series: Episode 1 "Man Trap"
item.description: This will be a series of notes I make on my observations of the changes in character and technology over the episodes. I have watched the Original Series once and recently so some things strike me as notable.
